abstract: Some Bancroft family members want to meet Rupert Murdoch to discuss his $5 billion offer for Dow Jones but they face stiff opposition from other relatives, The Financial Times reported. Mr. Murdoch has been pressing for a meeting with the Bancroft family, which controls the publishing company through a special class of stock, since they rejected his $60-per-share offer for the company and its flagship Wall Street Journal nearly two weeks ago.
lead_paragraph: Some Bancroft family members want to meet Rupert Murdoch to discuss his $5 billion offer for Dow Jones but they face stiff opposition from other relatives, The Financial Times reported. Mr. Murdoch has been pressing for a meeting with the Bancroft family, which controls the publishing company through a special class of stock, since they rejected his $60-per-share offer for the company and its flagship Wall Street Journal nearly two weeks ago.

headline.main: Some Bancrofts Open to Meeting With Murdoch, Report Says
